title: Quadruple shooting in DeKalb Co. neighborhood leaves 2 men dead
content:
DEKALB COUNTY, GA (CBS46) -
Police said a quadruple shooting left two men dead and two people critically injured in DeKalb County.
Police said the incident started at a nearby business where a car with at least two shooters followed a car with five people to the area of Dublin Drive and Shamrock Drive.
"Multiple individuals in the second vehicle began firing into the first vehicle. The driver of the first vehicle lost control and ran up into a yard," said Ford.
Officers believe the shooting was gang-related.
"It's not a random shooting. They were targeted," said DeKalb County Police Lt. A.W. Ford.
Police said the shooting may be related to two others.
They have not released the name of the man shot.
